page.title: 10THE OLD FORGE IN BOXFORD
page.content: There are still some Tudor houses left in Boxford. This is about the Blacksmith's Forge. The Forge was built around the same time as the church, about 1450 so the Forge is over 500 years old. Lots of people visited the church when it was finally built, but the people who came had to have somewhere to stay so they built an inn which was called "Chequers". People usually came on horseback or on foot so they had to have some stables for the horses to shelter in, they also had to have a Blacksmith's to make shoes for the horses, so the inn and the Blacksmith's was all one property.
